info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 9:22PM EDT until August 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL MONONGALIA...SOUTHEASTERN WETZEL AND MARION COUNTIES... At 922 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Mannington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Fairmont, Westover, Mannington, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Monongah, Fairview, Rivesville, Grant Town, Farmington, Worthington, Smithfield, Booth, Everettville, Folsom, McCurdyville, Metz, Curtisville, and Colfax. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
